com.rli.util.identityData

Class IdentityAttributePath

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rli.util.identityData.IdentityAttributePath

  • public class IdentityAttributePath
extends java.lang.Object
    An attribute path is an attribute selector: it provides a way to selectively target specific attributes in an IdentityData object. When combined with an operation, the attribute path is used to express exactly which attribute (or sub-attribute) to add/replace/remove value(s) for. In the case of complex value attributes, it can be used to specify exactly which sub-attribute to change. The attribute path notation follows the SCIM2 specification found here: RFC-7644, page 33-34

    Examples of valid attribute paths:
    • Simple primitive attributes: fullName
    • Complex sub-attributes: name.firstName
    • Complex sub-attributes with filters: addresses[type eq "work"].country

    • Method Detail

      • fromString

        public static IdentityAttributePath fromString(java.lang.String attributePathStr)
                                        throws IdentityDataException
        Returns an instance of an IdentityAttributePath object built from the specified attribute path String. Examples of valid attribute paths:
        • fullName
        • city
        • name.firstName
        • addresses[type eq "home"]
        • addresses[type eq "work"].country
        Parameters:
        attributePathStr - A valid attribute path String.
        Returns:
        an instance of an IdentityAttributePath object built from the specified attribute path String.
        Throws:
        IdentityDataException - If the specified attribute path is not valid or cannot be parsed properly.

      • isSimple

        public boolean isSimple()
        Indicates whether this attribute path is simple. A simple attribute path is simply composed of an attribute name and does not use sub-attribute or any kind of attribute filtering.
        Returns:
        true if this attribute path is simple (no sub-attributes, no filtering, just a simple attribute name), or false otherwise.

      • build

        public static IdentityAttributePath build(java.lang.String attribute)
        Returns an attribute path instance composed of a single attribute name (e.g: fullName)
        Parameters:
        attribute - The name of an attribute.
        Returns:
        an attribute path instance composed of a single attribute name.

      • build

        public static IdentityAttributePath build(java.lang.String attribute,
                                          java.lang.String subAttribute)
        Returns an attribute path instance composed of a single attribute name and a single sub-attribute for that attribute (e.g: name.givenName)
        Parameters:
        attribute - The name of an attribute.
        subAttribute - The name of the sub-attribute.
        Returns:
        an attribute path instance composed of a single attribute name and a single sub-attribute for that attribute.

      • build

        public static IdentityAttributePath build(java.lang.String attribute,
                                          java.lang.String subAttribute,
                                          java.lang.String equalityFilterSubAttrName,
                                          java.lang.String equalityFilterValue)
        Returns an attribute path instance composed of a single attribute name and a single sub-attribute with a sub-attribute filter equality filter (e.g: addresses[type eq "work"].city).
        Parameters:
        attribute - The name of an attribute.
        subAttribute - The name of a sub-attribute.
        equalityFilterSubAttrName - The name of a sub-attribute for the equality filter (left side of the equals sign)
        equalityFilterValue - The value for the equality filter (right side of the equals sign)
        Returns:
        an attribute path instance composed of a single attribute name and a single sub-attribute with a * sub-attribute filter equality filter (e.g: addresses[type eq "work"].city).
